  • public class InventoryUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Inventory related utility class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean equals(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv1, org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv2)
      Checks if two Inventory objects are "equal" To be equal, the names, titles, contents (ie, InventoryClickEvent should be cancelled) and location (if applicable) must be equal.
      static boolean equalsNoContents(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv1, org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv2)
      Check if two Inventory objects are equal, but not comparing their contents.

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv1,
                             org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv2)
        Checks if two Inventory objects are "equal" To be equal, the names, titles, contents (ie, InventoryClickEvent should be cancelled) and location (if applicable) must be equal.
        Parameters:
        inv1 - The first Inventory
        inv2 - The second Inventory
        Returns:
        if the two Inventory objects are equal

      • equalsNoContents

        public static boolean equalsNoContents(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv1,
                                       org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv2)
        Check if two Inventory objects are equal, but not comparing their contents.
        Parameters:
        inv1 - The first Inventory
        inv2 - The second Inventory
        Returns:
        true if both Inventory objects are not null, are of equal type, and have an equal title, otherwise false

      • firstIgnoreAmount

        public static int firstIgnoreAmount(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inv,
                                    org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack it)
        Get the first slot containing the given ItemStack in an inventory, ignoring button quantity
        Parameters:
        inv - The Inventory to get the button from
        it - The ItemStack to find
        Returns:
        The first slot containing the given ItemStack, or -1 if it doesn't exist or an exception occurs in BasecomponentReflection(unlikely)
